text: so what are your thoughts on Rust
shipping in the next kernel well for me
right now
the worst case is that it's an annoyance
the best case is that because now the
Linux kernel is using it there's no
choice but to talk about standardization
also because Linux is using rest or
Linux is going to be using rest that
enables a lot of possibilities in terms
of you know
this model driven development for
writing drivers like we see that with
Asahi like they modeled out
how the GPU driver should work and now
they are coding against that model to
create an actual Linux kernel driver and
that is a really powerful thing because
when you go all in with that approach to
writing programs for us they call it Con
they call it correct by construction you
can build programs much faster because
you can have the confidence that what
you're doing in Sprite so overall I'm
optimistic but at the same time
do I see rust being used in like the
variations of the Linux kernel that
Alpine ships in the next six to 12
months probably not right now we're
still working on ensuring that rest is
production ready
in Alpine
and until we are confident that it is
we're not going to you know have the
kernel depend on it
